description.narrative:
The intervention aims at contributing to democratic, credible, inclusive and peaceful national elections, planned to be held in Ethiopia in 2020. Expected results are as follows: - that the electoral management body (EMB) becomes capable, transparent and credible in organising the national elections in Ethiopia; - pre-conditions are created for inclusive, transparent and credible elections; - that the National Electoral Board of Ethiopia (NEBE), can ensure inclusive participation throughout the elections, amongst women, youth, and the different ethnic groups in all regions of Ethiopia, to contribute to a credible and inclusive electoral process.
Specific excpected results of the intervention are as follows: 1. The transparency, efficiency and inclusiveness of the electoral operations are enhanced through the operational support provided to the National Board of Ethiopia (NEBE) 1.1 Capacity of the permanent electoral officials enhanced to professionally deliver planning and implementation of gender-sensitive electoral legal reform 1.2 Professional, transparent and inclusive electoral operations supported 1.3 Voter registration operations are enhanced promoting inclusive participation of youth, women and disadvantaged groups 1.4 Inclusive and transparent Results Management System (RMS) enhanced 1.5 Procurement services availed 1.6 Post-electoral support provided to assess transparency, credibility and gender equality of the process
2. The capacity of the National Electoral Board of Ethiopia (NEBE) in conducting public outreach and external communication, including engagement with media and other key electoral stakeholders, is enhanced 2.1 NEBE communication and external relations capacity improved with a specific attention to conflict and gender-specific messaging 2.2 All electoral stakeholders informed and trained, and Media Centre established to encourage conflict- and gender-sensitive messaging 2.3 Civic/Voter education planned and well-coordinated ensuring inclusive participation of women and youth both as coordinators and beneficiaries
3. The capacity of the National Electoral Board of Ethiopia (NEBE) and other key stakeholders to identify, manage and respond to electoral violence enhanced 3.1 NEBE and its partners capacity to prevent electoral violence enhanced through a monitoring and early warning and response system (EVERS) 3.2 Electoral dispute resolution system is more effective and rights-based 3.3 Security forces are trained and sensitized to election security good practices

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
While the elections were postponed due to the COVID pandemic during 2020, the SEEDS programme has continued to support preparations for democratic elections and reached the following results during 2019-2021, and national elections were finally held in June 2021 (with the exeption of the Tigray region):
- Voting proceedures, and standards of voting material have been raised to ensure a more transparent and credible process. - Voting material have been procured, purchased, and safely stored. - Manuals for voter registration and voter education finalised, translated into various national languages, and used to enhance participation. - Special proceedures for voting of vulnerable groups were developed, for example for IDPs in collaboration with the IOM, although effective implementation of these proceedures were limited - Gender equality was integrated throughout the electoral process, through special mechanisms to enhance women's participation, both as candidates and voters. - Capacities of NEBE were greatly enhanced and additional staff for voter registration and education was recruited.
- A conflict mapping was done and a conflict management system developed to mitigare conflict, and this mapping and system will now be updated according to the current political situation/Tigray, etc. - A budget and protocols for COVID adapatation of the electoral process have been put in place.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
